name: Code Docs Codex
tagline: An archive of revised open source documentation
body:
### Welcome

This is a simple stub for [the Code Docs Codex](http://codedocscodex.org). I plan on putting some bones on these bones someday--and possibly even some meat, too!

### Purpose

The Codex is meant to collect my favorite programming documentation--and edit it thoroughly to make it both legible & current. As it is, so much of the documentation I reference is either out of date or written by monkeys.

### To Use

I neither have the skill nor the time to acquire the skill to make a decent website. I'm also cheap, or else I would use [Striking.ly](https://www.strikingly.com) or [Virb](http://virb.com). But not [Square Space](http://www.squarespace.com)--it can go to hell.

Anyway, code documenation will be maintained on the [GitHub Wiki](https://github.com/DeadDork/code-docs-codex/wiki). As an experiment, I am going to leave the edit setting on **all**, so don't be a Deuceberg and troll or I'll have to revert & restrict editing to just cool people.

### Licensing

I will only edit & archive documentation that is licensed permissibly--or at least permissibly enough (some older [software developers](http://invisible-island.net/personal/hackers.html) have [funny licenses](http://invisible-island.net/ncurses/ncurses-license.html) that hover in a gray area I'm not lawyer enough to understand).

If some documentation isn't explicitly licensed for at least non-commercial copy & revision, I will make a good faith effort to obtain such a license from the copyright holder. If I can't get ahold of the copyright holder, then I will consider the work orphaned, license the work as open source in the name of the copyright holder, and respect whatever her wishes might be should she contact me requesting I do otherwise. In such a case or if I succeed in getting ahold of the copyright holder but she doesn't permit me permission to edit & archive the work, I will try to create original open source documentation to fill that gap.

Regardless, all documentation is licensed **exactly** the same as it is licensed by the copyright holder.

What I am copyright holder to, though, is licensed broadly under an [MIT license](https://github.com/DeadDork/code-docs-codex/blob/master/MIT.license).
